body:
Comment 4 by **f.guerrieri**: 
Thanks. Notice that in my original code I was actually doing the equivalent of 
func BuggyNewMyType(a int) (v *myType){
	v:= new(NewMyType);
        v.a = a;
	return v;

}

and the compiler correctly told me that v was already declared, so I just 'blindly'
removed it and here we are :)

While I agree that it is not a bug per se, a runtime crash (without any warning from
the compiler) seems a bit surprising, don't you think?
